intro: Svensonia pterygocarpa, commonly known as the winged fruit tree, is a member of the Malvaceae family and is native to tropical regions of South America. It is characterized by its distinctive, winged fruits that are adapted for wind dispersal. The plant typically grows as a small to medium-sized tree with smooth, gray bark and lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are showy, with five petals and yellow stamens, contributing to its ornamental value. Svensonia pterygocarpa is also valued for its hard, durable wood, which is used in local crafts and construction.
